Generate INSPIRE / GISCO Grid-Cell IDs from Coordinates

Source: R/helpers.R
generate_grid_id_from_coords.Rd

A low-level helper function that computes standardized grid-cell identifiers from numeric coordinate vectors.

Usage

generate_grid_id_from_coords(xll, yll, cellsize, epsg, style, origin = c(0, 0))

Arguments

xll

A numeric vector of x-coordinates for the lower-left (south-west) corner of each cell.

yll

A numeric vector of y-coordinates for the lower-left (south-west) corner of each cell.

cellsize

The grid resolution in the units of the coordinates.

epsg

The integer EPSG code of the coordinate reference system.

style

The format of the output ID string: "gisco_full" or "gisco_short".

origin

A numeric vector of c(x, y) coordinates for the grid's origin.

Value

A character vector of grid-cell IDs.

On this page
